definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises

sentences.english: Yeah, the lighting and sound effects are first-class.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，舞臺燈光和音響效果都是一流的。

sentences.english: They think the sound effects in the cinema attracts them forever.
sentences.chinese: 他們感覺電影院的音響效果是永遠吸引他們的地方。

sentences.english: The sound effect in BaoLi cinema is great and I enjoyed myself.
sentences.chinese: 保利影院的音響效果不錯，非常享受。

sentences.english: The acoustics of the room have been expertly planned.
sentences.chinese: 這房間的音響效果設計得頗具匠心。

sentences.english: The sound effects had been prerecorded and were added to the dialogue.
sentences.chinese: 音響效果經預錄後已加入到對話中。

sentences.english: The acoustics are not very good, I have trouble understanding some bit.
sentences.chinese: 音響效果不太好，有些地方我聽不太清。

sentences.english: The acoustics of this theater are admirable .
sentences.chinese: 這個劇院的音響效果很好。

sentences.english: When selecting a location take acoustics into account.
sentences.chinese: 在選擇場地的時候，要考慮到音響效果。

sentences.english: The acoustics is not very good, I have trouble understanding some bit.
sentences.chinese: 音響效果不太好，有些地方我聽不太清。

sentences.english: The acoustics are not very good, I had trouble understanding some bits.
sentences.chinese: 音響效果不太好，有些地方我聽不太清。

sentences.english: The DVD has the standard video and sound settings.
sentences.chinese: DVD有着合乎標準的視頻和音響效果。

sentences.english: He whoofed into the hand mike experimentally before the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 會前他向話筒裏呼哧呼哧地吹氣試驗音響效果。

sentences.english: The acoustics in this church were wonderful and the simplicity of the place very moving.
sentences.chinese: 在這個教堂的音響效果是美好的和簡單的地方很感人。

definition: to postpone one's graduation (e.g. by undertaking additional studies) (abbr. for 延後畢業|延后毕业[yan2 hou4 bi4 ye4])
to make a fool of oneself
to keep on the right side of everyone (idiom)/warm and affable
lit. Lord Ye's passion for dragons (idiom)/fig. to pretend to be fond of sth while actually fearing it/ostensible fondness of sth one really fears
